To Henderson, who judges thousands of eviction cases per year, the only explanation for such action was landlord lobbying. The Tennessee Association of Realtors is the sixth largest spender on Tennessee politics, according to the Tennessee Lookout’s database, having spent $6.5 million on lobbying, campaign donations and other political expenditures since 2009.
“Landlords have always had a very strong lobbying group,” she said.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Judge Deborah Henderson was quite candid with the renters gathered to learn about the eviction process; she judges thousands of eviction cases per year

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: In the statement, Swann said the bill will help landlords free up apartments more quickly for the thousands of Tennesseeans seeking a home. He also said it would help the apartment industry develop new apartments, but he didn’t make clear how it would.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Given TAR’s opposition and the legislature itself having recently moved “much farther to the right,” in his experience, Thompson said a Shelby County rental registry is “probably not in the cards, for several years anyway.” Though he’s not running for reelection, he’s hopeful whoever succeeds him will be able to find other ways to help cities deal with slumlords.

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement: Assuming the bill is signed by Lee, it will require landlords to provide tenants with a phone number or online portal they can use to make maintenance requests. While most landlords do this already, Thompson said he’s heard from tenants who tell him they have no way of contacting their landlord or property manager about maintenance issues.
Sourcing Table.Source Justification: Rep. Dwayne Thompson (D-Cordova) was involved in legislative efforts related to rental housing and tenant protections

Sourcing Table.Sourced Statement:
Still, Rees sees the legislation’s passage as a win. Because even if landlords aren’t responsive, it will provide tenants with proof they’re requesting maintenance through the proper channels — proof lawyers like Rees could theoretically use in their defense.
“I really am happy to see that pass,” Rees said. “I think it’s important that tenants do have good quality contact information for their property manager or owner.”
